info.title: Validate
info.description: Provides methods to validate and check the availability of username, web aliases, e-mail addresses, etc...

get.description:
Validates whether a Username already exists.

Note: All parameters that are passed on the URL must be encoded so that any extended characters are processed correctly.

404.description: The given Username was not found (does not exist).

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Validates whether a Tax Id already exists.

Note: All parameters that are passed on the URL must be encoded so that any extended characters are processed correctly.

200.description: The given Tax ID was found (exists).

404.description: The given Tax ID was not found (does not exist).

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Validates a Username/Password combination.

Note: All parameters that are passed on the URL must be encoded so that any extended characters are processed correctly.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The Username of the customer to validate.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The Password of the customer to validate.

200.description: The Username/Password combination is valid. This returns the Customer belonging to that combination.

404.description: The Username/Password combination is invalid/not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.
